snippet: In Bend, Ore., where there is no Interstate, no university and the closest major city is 160 miles away across steep and snowy mountains, beer has had room to make a difference.
abstract: Bend, Ore, Journal; craft beer makers and purveyors have helped Bend weather hard economic times; city of 80,000 is relatively isolated, but Deschutes County reported 450 brewery and brew pub jobs in 2010, or 15 percent of all brewing employment in the state.
lead_paragraph: In Bend, Ore., where there is no Interstate, no university and the closest major city is 160 miles away across steep and snowy mountains, beer has had room to make a difference.

headline.main: An Economic Lifeline of Barley and Hops
headline.print_headline: An Economic Lifeline of Barley and Hops
